div.head: Amendment of the Code of Academic Ethics
div.p:
TO: University Faculty Council
FROM: Affirmative Action Committee
DATE: March 27, 1985
SUBJECT: Amendment of the
Code of Academic Ethics

In the course of reviewing the policy on nepotism, the Faculty Council Affirmative Action Committee discussed intimate, personal relationships between persons who are not related by blood or marriage and which therefore do not fall under the policy on nepotism. The committee found that such relationships frequently create difficulties similar to those which the policy on nepotism is designed to prevent. To address this problem the Affirmative Action Committee moves the amendment of the Code of Academic Ethics as indicated in Section A below.

The committee also discussed intimate, personal relationships between faculty and students. The committee felt that such relationships and efforts to invite them give rise to complaints of sexual harassment and impair the trust and professional integrity which are necessary for an academic community to flourish. Accordingly, the Affirmative Action Committee recommends the amendment of the Code of Academic Ethics as indicated in Section B below.

list.item:
THE FOLLOWING PARAGRAPH SHALL BE ADDED TO SECTION A ("RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES"), SUBSECTION "SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES," OF THE CODE OF ACADEMIC ETHICS [PAGE 47 ff. OF THE 1982 ACADEMIC HANDBOOK]. IT SHALL BE NUMBERED 14, AND ALL FOLLOWING PARAGRAPHS SHALL BE RENUMBERED.
14. IN THE INTEREST OF AVOIDING ACTUAL OR PERCEIVED CONFLICT OF INTEREST, ACADEMIC PERSONNEL SHALL NOT DIRECTLY SUPERVISE EMPLOYEES WITH WHOM THEY ARE HAVING SEXUAL, AMOROUS, OR SUBSTANTIAL FINANCIAL RELATIONSHIPS. ACADEMIC SUPERVISORS SHALL DISQUALIFY THEMSELVES FROM EMPLOYMENT-RELATED DECISIONS CONCERNING SUCH EMPLOYEES AND, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE EMPLOYEE INVOLVED AND OTHER APPROPRIATE PERSONS, THE DEAN OF THE FACULTIES OR OTHER EQUIVALENT CAMPUS ADMINISTRATOR SHALL TAKE STEPS FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SURROGATE SUPERVISOR.

THE FOLLOWING PARAGRAPH SHALL BE ADDED TO SECTION A ("RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES"), FOLLOWING THE SUBSECTION "RELATIONS WITH COLLEAGUES" OF THE CODE OF ACADEMIC ETHICS [PAGE 48 OF THE 1982 ACADEMIC HANDBOOK].
RELATIONS WITH STUDENTS. THE FACULTY SUBSCRIBES TO THE LONGSTANDING ACADEMIC NORM THAT SEXUAL OR AMOROUS RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN FACULTY (AS WELL AS ASSOCIATE INSTRUCTORS) AND STUDENTS FOR WHOM THEY HAVE PROFESSIONAL RESPONSIBILITY ARE UNACCEPTABLE EVEN WHEN BOTH PARTIES HAVE CONSENTED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SUCH A RELATIONSHIP. SUCH RELATIONSHIPS NOT ONLY RAISE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE PROFESSIONAL INTEGRITY OF THE PARTICULAR FACULTY MEMBER (OR ASSOCIATE INSTRUCTOR) INVOLVED BUT ALSO OF THE UNIVERSITY AS A WHOLE. FURTHERMORE, WHEN SUCH LIAISONS OCCUR, THEY CAN LEAD TO DEMORALIZATION AMONG OTHER STUDENTS, WHO MAY PERCEIVE A STUDENT IN SUCH A RELATIONSHIP AS BENEFITING IN A SPECIAL WAY IN TERMS OF ACADEMIC, FINANCIAL, OR CAREER OPPORTUNITIES.
